page.title: 12CATTLE FARMING.
page.content: A typical cattle farm is 160 acres which would support 110 milking cows, 70 beef cattle, a bull, 20 calves & 75 heifers.Two favourite breeds are Fresian & Fresian/Hereford Cross.Calves are born at any time of year & in an average year there might be 110.Barren cows are sold at Bakewell Market & beef to Whalley & Thorpe Butchers.Barley,silage,cake compound,molasses,fish meal,sugar beet,milk powder & calf pellets supplement the natural food.E.E.C. regulations have had a bad effect on cattle farming by stopping expansion. The average cost of running a farm like this is about Â£52,000 per annum.
